ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Angel Hsu
Angel Hsu
Angel Shu
Angel Hsu
Angel Hsu
Angel Hsu
Angel Hsu

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The assignments were incredibly repetitive. It seemed like we went over the same handful of concepts again and again. This drained my enthusiasm for the topics.

I very much enjoy the subject of governance. The readings by O'Neil and Clapp& Dauvergne were particularly useful. It might be interesting to include Gus Speth's latest book in the readings next year, to show how his "Worldview" changed over time...
The short reading essays really contributed to my comprehension of the material.The prof explained theories very well and used practical examples, which was very helpful.
The papers provided that was for a great help for the understanding of the different aspects of international environmental governance and policies.

The homework and class activities and exercises were very helpful to understand in a practical way the theories and concepts that we were learning in class.The material, articles and lectures were very interesting.The participation of guest lecturers was very valuable and interesting.
The new concepts of practiced sustainability are interesting.
Good discussions occasionally.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: In some ways the response essays felt a little repetitive - it appeared each time we were simply applying the Worldviews to a problem. While this is helpful, it might be good to dedicate one response essay to something completely different - perhaps to something like "Governmentality"...
The prof was out of town for two classes and we had several guest speakers. I would have liked to have more classroom time with the profs rather than from guest speakers.
The instruction will need to provide feedbacks to assignments some days after the deadline and not at the end of the course so that we can improve our skills and our understanding over the classes.
Professor Cashore should revise the assignments. I would have been more engaged by fewer, more developed assignments as opposed to the barrage of busy work and long assignments we received.
I don't think that something needs improvement.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Angel was always happy to meet and discuss papers - excellent.
Both were very available and willing to help. I felt strongly supported by the prof and TA when I needed help.
The instructor was almost unavailble. The TA shown some willingness to help and had sometimes provided guidances for reading.

The TA was helpful and always showed availability and willingness to answer my questions.The instructor was also very helpful and opened to answer my questions or discuss the material seen in class and assignments.
She was able to help check students' papers before submitting as well as organizing the class schedule.
I contacted both the instructor and the TA for help. They were both available and gave me the best quality of help.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I come from somewhat of a political science background. Therefore, applying the topics of policy and governance to the environment was particularly fascinating to me. In terms of fitting in with the rest of my studies, I believe it helps me to understand the workings of institutions and the "hidden" relationships between the 4 IR theories and the 4 Worldviews.
Yes. I think this class is critical for anyone pursuing a career in env. policy.
This course fits enterely with my forestry program since it focused on update forest governance issue such as certification.
It fulfilled a Bin req.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Professor Cashore comes highly recommended. The course topic is extremely appealing to me.
I took this course to get more of a top down understanding of env policy (on the international level rather than the local level).
I took the course because I wanted to know how policymakers are designing policies in the realm of forestry.
The opening class was exciting and I thought that all the topics were very interesting.
Curious about the FSC system.
It fulfilled a Bin req.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes - it was great. I sometimes wished that it was broken up into two 80 minute classes, rather than one 3 hour class.
Yes.
The course didn't live up my expectations at all.
Yes, it was my favorite class of the semester.
Yes
Yes!

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes - great set of readings. I had also never studied forestry and fisheries before, so that was great.
I thought I would learn more about env. treaties and orgs, and I am glad that instead, I learned more about env. cooperation and international governance theory.
Ididn't get out of it with what I expected at all. I will need to take additional courses in policy to complement this hollow.
Yes, even more.
I think so.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Dig into Clapp& Dauvergne and Kate O'Neil. If those books interest you, you can thrive in this class.
Staying on top of the readings is critical because there are many writing assignments.
Students taking this course need to know that the course is focusing just in some issues over the international environmental governance such as climate change, forestry, fisheries and biodiversity.
The professor likes straight answers. It should be kept in mind that you answer the questions being asked when writing papers.
Be ready for a lot of work, but it's definately worth it!!
